docs.lead_paragraph: Peter R. Orszag will leave his job as the White House budget director in July, according to someone familiar with his plans, making him perhaps the first official to leave the Obama Cabinet and removing a major player from President Obama's economic team.
docs.abstract: The timing of Peter J. Orszag's departure is dictated by two timing issues: the drafting of the next budget and his wedding.
docs.snippet: The timing of Peter J. Orszag's departure is dictated by two timing issues: the drafting of the next budget and his wedding.

docs.lead_paragraph: The five Democratic candidates vying to become New York's top prosecutor gathered together for the first time on Monday to make their cases.

headline.main: Candidates for Attorney General Make Their Case

docs.abstract: It was fairly tepid, but at a forum on Monday, the five Democratic candidates for state attorney general did offer their ideas for the job.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

docs.lead_paragraph: When scholars assess how the Democratic Congress managed to pass a landmark health care overhaul in 2010, they might assign a bit of the credit to liberal talk show hosts. A new study by the Project for Excellence in Journalism finds that health care was a ''much bigger topic'' for liberal hosts like Keith Olbermann and Ed Schultz than for conservative hosts like Glenn Beck and Sean Hannity.
docs.abstract: Media Decoder blog notes Project for Excellence in Journalism finds liberal talk show hosts spent 44 percent of their airtime talking about health care bill from June 2009 to March 2010, while conservative hosts spent 26 percent of their airtime on subject; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant or sick and without health coverage? Well, you can always hold a fundraiser and get the strippers to work for no charge. Once again "Friday Night Lights" poignantly got at the hardships experienced by the more troubled sector of the two Americas. Mindy's early contractions signaled complications with her pregnancy and Billy does not have any insurance. To even keep her safely in the hospital for a night -- she's got to go on bed rest -- is going to be a huge struggle for him financially. But Mindy's stripper friends rally together to offer their services for free to raise money for her treatment. It is moments like these that give "Friday Night Lights'' the tempered levity that keeps it from being relentlessly melodramatic. Terrible things keep happening to people, but there are always displays of resilience and wherewithal.

headline.main: 'Friday Night Lights' Watch: Of Tragedy and Resiliency

docs.abstract: "Friday Night Lights'' just never lets up on the selfish dads, and this episode felt like a very subversive Father's Day special.
docs.snippet: "Friday Night Lights'' just never lets up on the selfish dads, and this episode felt like a very subversive Father's Day special.
